channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in New Zealand on 27 April
item.description: On the final day under alert level 4, there were five new cases of Covid-19 in NZ and another death, while a contact tracing app gets closer and businesses gear up for level 3.

item.title: Covid-19: Your alert level 3 travel questions answered
item.description: While level 3 allows a bit more movement for people, those anticipating a sojourn too far from their neighbourhood still need a very good reason to travel.

item.title: One new confirmed case of Covid-19 today, but one further death
item.description: There has been just one new confirmed case of Covid-19 in New Zealand, and four new probable cases, but the death toll has now risen to 19. Watch the latest briefing here.

item.title: Lockdown breaches: 87 prosecutions over Anzac weekend
item.description: Police prosecuted 87 people for lockdown breaches over Anzac weekend, but have praised most New Zealanders for sticking to the alert level 4 restrictions.

item.title: 'School is as safe as it's ever been' - infectious disease expert
item.description: Parents are being reassured that it is as safe as it has ever been to send children back to school.

item.title: Testing at a Hawke's Bay holiday park after positive result
item.description: Residents at a Hawke's Bay holiday park are all being tested for Covid-19 after one of them tested positive for the virus.

item.title: Second of three repatriation flights from India enroute to Christchurch
item.description: Nearly 200 people on a government-assisted flight from India are due to arrive in Christchurch tonight.

item.title: Covid-19: New Zealand contact tracing app due within two weeks
item.description: The success of a mobile app to contact trace Covid-19 cases depends on whether its users can trust their data will be protected, privacy and technology experts say.

item.title: As it happened: Covid-19 updates from NZ and around the world
item.description: The Prime Minister says NZ could remain at Alert Level 3 for longer than two weeks if that was required. see how the rest of the day's events unfolded with RNZ's blog.

item.title: Rim of the Pacific naval exercise risks Covid-19 spread - activists, academics
item.description: Dozens of academics and human rights activists are urging the government to avoid sending troops to a naval exercise in the US amid fears of Covid-19 spreading.

item.title: White Island volcano victims to sue Royal Caribbean
item.description: Legal action is being pursued against Royal Caribbean cruise line over the Whakaari/White Island eruption as extraordinary new details of the effort to rescue survivors are revealed.

item.title: Beefed up safety measures for reopened courts
item.description: Extra safety measures are being put in place for when district courts reopen to the public on Tuesday.

item.title: Moderate, deep earthquake strikes near Te Anau
item.description: Fiordland has been rattled by a 5.6 magnitude earthquake this morning.

item.title: Flu vaccinations double from last year - government
item.description: Some 587,000 people have been given the influenza vaccine, up from 290,000 a year ago, and New Zealand is on track for one in three people immunised, the associate health minister says.

item.title: AA urges bypass for dangerous Woodend roads
item.description: After 20 years of no progress, now is the time to construct a highway that bypasses Woodend, the AA says.

item.title: Ski fields likely to open at alert level 2, with reduced attendance - NZ Ski
item.description: The ski industry is cautiously optimistic it will be able to open for a locals' season under alert level 2, and for visitors under level 1.

item.title: Covid-19: Bus union calls for higher wages under lockdown
item.description: The largest union for bus drivers wants those working to get better wages through the Covid-19 lockdown, and stronger protections when the alert levels drop.

item.title: South Island road crashes leave seven injured overnight
item.description: Several people were injured in a spate of serious crashes in the South Island late last night.
